Reviews.Title: Great Tab especially if you get it refurbished. under $300
Reviews.Author: Toineg1
Reviews.Content: I have been purchasing Sam Tabs since the Galaxy Tab 2 7.  Since then I have had the Tab 2 10.1 and the famous and wish they would have kept improving Tab 7.7 which I still have. I also have the Note 2 and a first gen iPad. I wouldn't have even purchased the Note 8 if I had not cracked my screen on the 7.7.  Glad I did purchase it though.  It's faster and showed the age of my 7.7 with how it handles the whole experience of using a tablet.  I won't go thru all the tech stuff that many have submitted.  But I can address the issue of the upgrade to Jellybean 4.2.2.  Samsung must have corrected the problem that many have described where the multi-window functionality stopped working after installing it.  Mine not only worked fine but to my surprise and pleasure, the unit installed all my apps that I had on my 7.7 and afterwards installed the upgrade with no loss of data.  It even restored all my photos that i had on my other units;I purchased the Moko slim case with a magnet.  It may be a little early to tell if it's the magnet or not but every now and then when I fold the flap in back of the tablet hand touches are nonresponsive.  Oddly enough though, the pen still worked.  If I turn it off and back on again the hand touches worked again.  I will use it without the case for a day or 2 to see if that is the problem.  I heard this unit has had problems with magnetized covers.  Otherwise, the experience I have with this tablet is very similar to what I have with the Note 2.  Excellent.  My only gripe is that it didn't come with a better display.  The colors are beautiful and reading text are sharp but the movie experience is no where near as crisp as the Note 2 or even as crisp as my Galaxy 7.7.  Another complaint that i have read is the size of the bezel.  What a silly quibble.  My 7.7 has the exact same size bezel and it was haled as one of the best tablets of its time.  The thing cost $700 without contract when it came out and now we pay 3-400 for a tab that is more powerful and feature rich and complain it cost too much.  i tried using the other tablets with a thinner bezel and my hand kept touching the darn screen activating various apps I didn't want loaded.Plastic is another issue.  Almost all tablets are made of either plastic or aluminum or a combination of the 2.  Look and feel are subjective preferences but to use a tablet without having a protective cover is not very wise imho.Once you place a cover on it, look and feel go out the window anyway.One more quibble.  Battery life.  Not the greatest.  The note 2 lasts all day with heavy use.  I have never been able to max it out even watching movies, surfing, gaming, using the phone etc.  The Note 8 not so much.  You have to put it on power saving mode to get the best life out of it.  I have only had it for 2 days and I already had to charge it once and right now it's at 74%.  Shame on you Samsung.  My Galaxy 7.7 gets better battery life.  But then again it has a super amoled plus display that uses less power with more punch in color and vibrance.  Better blacks too.Even with these caveats, the Note 8 is a great tablet to use and since it is a tablet and not a phone you get true "desktop" web browsing, more screen realestate and Samsung Note apps and usability to boot.  Not bad for $289.  If you want the magazine UI you can download Chameleon Launcher and get the best of both worlds.  Just thought I'd through that in for free.  The launcher needs a little work but it does change the way you see and utilize your tablet.  Better categorizing of home screens etc.Would I recommend the Note 8.0?  Now that you can get at a price point that competes with iPad mini, Nexus 7 and LG G8.3... Yeahhh!

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet
Reviews.Author: Andrew Tapay
Reviews.Content: I had it narrowed down to this tablet, the Galaxy Note 10.1 (2014), and possibly an iPad (comparable in price to the Note 10.1).I saw this one for $230, factory refurbished. The price was irresistible.I couldn't be happier. I was concerned that the screen was a little to small. I use this mainly for watching videos (often on plane rides) and grading papers (college-level Math homework).I got a (free) Android app for annotating PDF's that I use to grade papers electronically. Having the stylus is indispensable for this purpose, especially because it's very difficult to type Mathematical symbols into any word processor. One can use typesetting software, but this is very impractical when you just want to grade papers.Streaming video over wifi (ESPN3, HBOGO, Netflix) works very well. For plane rides, the Android video player works very well. I have to convert some video files to mp4, but there is viable software on the internet (cost-free) to do this. The battery has been more than sufficient for flying coast-to-coast (unlike my old laptop's battery).I highly recommend the Galaxy Note 8.0. I was a little concerned that the screen would be too small, but I find it to be perfect for my purposes. I like Apple products very much, but I don't think I would be as satisfied with an iPad for its lack of stylus and inflexibility with video playback. (And no, I'm not converting back to Windows or Linux, I still love my MacBook and I'll get another when it dies (6 years and going).)

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: maxine brown
Reviews.Content: I bought it becasue I travel alot and its easy to carry and has  a number of unique features. So far its working great for me

Reviews.Title: Perfect form factor for reading.  Go Samsung!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I use this primarily for reading.  It's the perfect screen size.  Adding a leather case made it much easier to hold onto (it's very thin...and finish is smooth plastic, so, you have to be very careful not to drop it).Love the fact that is has a stylus.I bought this as a big brother to my Note 2 phone.  Does everything I need and then some.  I'm a firm believer in Samsung's Note devices.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Tablet
Reviews.Author: Stephen T. Eckel "Go Navy"
Reviews.Content: Fast, smooth, and what I hoped for in a smaller portable tablet.  The split screen is excellent.  The stylus is very useful; takes a bit of practice.  Apps noted as optimized for phone work very well on this tablet (just bigger).Easy to set up out of the box, be ready to log in your Samsung and Google accounts.  Will then import in all your Google and Samsung apps and info.One quirk to be prepared to handle - some users, including me, have a problem when the tablet automatically upgrades from android 4.1.2 (out of box) to 4.2.2.  This happens right away.  I soon noticed that the multi screen feature and the quick screen did not work.  Could not fix.  Went to blogs and learned that this is a known problem (thanks Samsung).  The solution is not as scary as it sounds.  Go to settings,backup and select factory reset.  Reinstalls 4.1.2.  Will automatically update to 4.2.2 again, but this time without the error noted above.  Joy, except you now have to set up the tablet all over again.  Any apps and preferences you earlier set have to be redone.  Cost me a half hour or so.Once past that unpleasantness, great experience and great tablet.  Definitely get the Google keyboard as it is superior to the Samsung keyboard; Swype is so fast.The processor is fast! The integration is excellent.  Widgets are excellent.  The Google apps work well together (definitely look into most all of them).  Screen is sharp and as bright as you desire it to be.  Tablet form factor excellent and easy with one hand (OK, I am a male and have a good sized hand).  Battery life good; I charged when I opened it Tue afternoon and all night Tue and still have 27% battery late Thursday night (full disclosure - I only use a bit at breakfast and after work).I would but this tablet again and really like it.  Amazon delivered in two days as promised and charged $30 less than the competition.

Reviews.Title: I love this thing.
Reviews.Author: T. Davis "killerjello"
Reviews.Content: I love drawing on this tablet with the s-pen, I've actually made a full color paid illustration with it. Oh yeah.

Reviews.Title: WHY DID I EVER HAD AN IPAD?????
Reviews.Author: PSantO
Reviews.Content: This Galaxy Note is the smartest coolest tablet in the market. After getting this I gave away my ipad. Seriously it is that good.

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet
Reviews.Author: Jedidiah
Reviews.Content: I love the tablet. The charger broke within the first month. Fortunately I have other micro USB chargers I was able to use.

Reviews.Title: BODACIOUS!
Reviews.Author: John Eucare
Reviews.Content: There's nothing I don't love about this! the pen rocks the apps rock the response and internet speed rock - it accesses memory fast and its interface is smooth. It has strong reception for wifi and the picture is awesome - even without retina the size makes HD video POP out of the screen. The control you have with this pen is unbelievable. I wish I had this as a young artist. I would have saved thousands in tracing paper pastels watercolors calligraphy pens and ink!

Reviews.Title: Better than any iPad!
Reviews.Author: Shelby L
Reviews.Content: I am in love with this tablet. Perfect size for someone who doesn't want a huge tablet to carry. I don't know why people buy iPads, when the Note has a ton more accessibility with the split screen, office suite and s-note. S-note makes taking notes so much easier than on a laptop with just word. I own a Macbook, however hate carrying it around everywhere because of how much space it take up. The stylus is also nice, because my boyfriend has bigger fingers so it's harder to touch smaller links.NOTE: This is not the same as the Tab 8. I wasn't aware of his until I went to Best Buy and was playing around with them

Reviews.Title: Perfect as a productivity tool.
Reviews.Author: VTHokie
Reviews.Content: I would give this a long write up on why I like it, but I think it's safe to say that the others (especially the guy with 80+ reviews) has captured all the benefits of this device. What I will say is the s-pen is a lot more useful than I imagined it to be. I use it to take notes for a language class I am taking. As others know, it's difficult to type in another language, especially if you don't have a keyboard with the keys you need. I didn't want to deal with generating more paper waste since I tend to use a lot of scrap paper. This has replaced all my scrap paper. The size of this is perfect that I carry it around with me almost as much as my phone.The thing I would recommend Samsung to improve is some sort of wrist recognition by the buttons. when writing on lecturenotes or s-notes, my wrist tends to hit the back button. I avoid this by using the tablet in widescreen mode as it gives me more writing space while moving the buttons out of the way.

Reviews.Title: Happy with this tablet
Reviews.Author: CHRIS M.
Reviews.Content: This is a very good tablet. l leave it at work and go into meetings with it as my notepad using S-Note with S-Pen. Using it without character recognition I can keep my attention on what's going on in the meeting. Having to deal with character recognition is worse than using the virtual keyboard, in other words it takes too much attention away from meetings. I otherwise use the character recognition for all other input (like now).I'd use it more with multi-user support - that's a endearing feature. I would also appreciate Web access to my S-note cloud backup. I'm left to assume that the only way to get access to my notes if my tablet dies or disappears is to go buy a new device and restore. This doesn't strike me as efficient or optimal.l find the 8-inch size ideal. It's fun to have portable copies of docs on my tablet instead of paper, and I can mark them up or point using Polaris Office while attached to a projector. A few at the office have followed suit and got themselves work tablets. Those with the Note are happy.

Reviews.Title: Great product!!
Reviews.Author: Dominic Cariaso
Reviews.Content: If you like taking down notes at work, at school or for whatever reason, this is the product for you. I was skeptical at first but writing on this Samsung Galaxy Note 8.0 is as natural as writing on paper. I even had my daughter who is a great sketch artist test it and  she was very impressed on the accuracy of the pen and natural feel drawing on it. I highly recommend this product.Dominic

Reviews.Title: Galaxy Note 8.0 (16GB, White)
Reviews.Author: Christopher
Reviews.Content: I really love my Galaxy Note 8.0.  I use it all the time for reading, listening to audiobooks, and checking out the internet while not near a computer.  I purchased a 64GB micro sd card to go along with it.  Since I've purchased this back in June 2012, I've hardly used my iPad 3 except for a few things at work.  I highly recommend the product for those that prefer Android over iOS.

Reviews.Title: Still the best.
Reviews.Author: Drewsky
Reviews.Content: In terms of size, speed and functionality it is still unrivaled in the 7"-8" category. Sure it might be beaten for speed by a few, looks by a few, resolution by a few, built quality by a few. But this has a little of everything including the digital pen making it the most versatile tablet in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: Great 8 inch tablet
Reviews.Author: MB.
Reviews.Content: I upgraded to the Samsung Galaxy Note 8.0 from a 1st Generation iPad and couldn't be more pleased.  The device is compact but has a great screen and the S-pen works well for reviewing PDFs and highlighting (primary functions for me).  It fits in a medical lab coat quite well and holds a charge without issue.Only cons are the preloaded Samsung software (messaging, etc.) that I know I'll never use.  Otherwise it's perfect.I bought mine on Amazon's Warehouse Deals at a significant savings.  While I was initially a bit worried about buying a returned item the return policy eased my anxiety.  Besides preowned appearing packaging I wouldn't have known I wasn't the first owner.  It was definitely worth buying from the Warehouse.3 month update:  I'm still liking this tablet a lot and has a good mix of productivity and entertainment capability.  I was briefly swayed by the new Google Nexus 7 but this tablet has been a great fit.  The s-pen is indispensible for working with pdfs and when using the note taking software.  It does a great job of capturing my handwriting quickly and accurately.  The included Polaris Office allows one to manage office files on the go and to review presentations without having to buy additional software.  I have used it on multiple flights and the video playback is very nice.Bottom line:  This is a great business and entertainment tablet that is a quantum leap from my iPad 1.  If you don't need to work with highlighting/note taking then the s-pen may not hold a lot of value for you and you may be served better by Samsung's other s-pen-less tablets.  If your priorities are gaming/HD video/the crispest screen then look at the Nexus or retina iPads.  If you want a well-balanced tablet that's reasonably priced and offers the expanded capability of the s-pen then look no further.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Digital Sketchbook
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Edit:  I recently started using Layerpaint HD (a tablet optimized version of Layerpaint with layer modes) and the experience has improved even more.  I can now confidently create finished artwork with it.The Note 8 is an outstanding tablet.  It is very capable for media consumption, such as music, video or even ebooks; all in a neat portable package.  I personally bought it for the previous reasons, but also for the possibility of drawing and painting with the most natural input possible.  Using the Layerpaint app, I have integrated it seamlessly into my workflow*; when the mood strikes I just jot a sketch or two and either finish it right there on the spot, or continue at home with my PC.What advantages does it offer against the competition?1)Wacom technology.  It has 1024 levels of pressure sensitivity, which should make your line work look more natural.  Heck, you can easily calibrate the stylus (and even the app, in some cases) if you dislike the pressure curve or the "cursor" precision!2)The S-Pen has a small tip!  While some people have enough ability to create art with any tool, I am not skilled enough.  Having a smaller contact point with the screen gives me more control and precision, as opposed to using my fingertip or a fat stylus.3)Can handle high resolution, multi-layer files.  With the app I mention above, I have even created 300 DPI and 600 DPI files.  Why is that significant? Because that's print quality, and you can continue whatever you start in the Note 8 with your laptop and be ready for print or web with minor compromises.The one con, and it's a big one, is that currently there are not as many drawing/painting apps as for iOS, but it's a situation that will be resolved over time; Wacom just released an Android based professional tablet that should move things along in that department.  If you look around though, you will find an app or two that will fulfill your needs, and who knows, it could end up becoming an important part of you art routine too.*My current digital only setup is:  Note 8 + Layerpaint HD + Windows 8 Laptop + Wacom Intuos 3 + Manga Studio EX 5.  I do use a standalone Samsung S-Pen which I tweaked to make the pressure sensitivity a bit firmer.Manga Studio 5Manga Studio EX 5Wacom Intuos3 6 x 8-Inch Pen TabletSamsung Galaxy S-Pen Stylus Pen with Eraser for Galaxy Note II

Reviews.Content: this thing is amazing. Its super fast and the perfect size. I own other tablets that are 7 in  seem small. My Motorola 10 in is to big. This 8.0 is perfect.  Very powerfull. It's amazing what this thing will do. I purchased it for my wife. Should have kept it for myself.Very thin and light. The stylus works great. Battery life is outstanding.I have never wrote a review on product. I had to on this one. its that good!!!.we looked at an I pad mini and full size. My wife uses this for her job. More of the APPS she needed are on android not IOS.I have used many I products. Hands down Samsung is leading the market. Things thing will run to apps at the same time. plus it has an SD card slot for more memory. The only thing this needs is an key board. It was ordered last night.Thanks samsung for making a great product.

Reviews.Title: LOVE LOVE LOVE
Reviews.Author: jeciwall28
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love my Galaxy Note tablet. I did extensive research before purchasing. Let me start by saying I am not a loyalist when it comes to electronics...I own a Dell PC, a MacBook, a HTC cell phone and now this Samsung tablet.It is lightening fast and the S-pen is the best part. It makes writing so much easier instead of typing in a keyboard. It is the perfect size to carry in my rather small purse, as I like to read my Kindle books and watch my Netflix during my son's Karate classes.

Reviews.Title: best phone and tablet
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I bought my note 8 2 months ago.  I have been very pleased with it.  Like a lot of people,  my only regret was not be able to watch movies while browsing the Web.  It bugs me a lot while I watched my coworkers watch movies on their ipad in free time.  Many said I have to root my device.  It sounds complicated because I'm a user not a tech.  Then I decided to Google it.  I got lucky for tumble on WCCFTECH.COM they have Flash Player for Android 4.1 or the later.  They also have instructions how to install it.  It is very simple. Reviews.Title: Great Device
Reviews.Author: ERIC
Reviews.Content: I was a little skeptic at getting this device at first but after watching a few reviews about the note 8.0 I was like I want this. I just received it today an I'm very impressed with everything. The tablet is amazing. It's very fast an snappy. I use to have the Asus Transformer Prime which was a good table but this is way better in every way to me. I was a little concerned about the resolution of the screen based on the spec's before I purchased the device. After I played with it for a while the screen looks absolutely amazing. So far this device is worth every penny I spent on it. I also have the Galaxy S 4 which is another fantastic device. I love Samsung products. They do a great job on their devices. Also the software on here in fantastic with a ton of features.

Reviews.Title: best all around tablet
Reviews.Author: Michel Khairallah
Reviews.Content: I have a ipad mini and I've used allot of tablets through the years like ipads and note 10.1 I also own a note 2 and I must say the note 8.0 is the most useful and portable one

Reviews.Title: Exactly as I Had Hoped
Reviews.Author: Sheree White
Reviews.Content: I am thrilled with my new Samsung Galaxy Note 8.0 tablet. This is my very first tablet and I believe I made a great choice. I chose this tablet because I wanted the ability to take notes in my handwriting rather than type. I recently went to a 3 day conference and used it continually for notes and email without having to recharge. I'm extremely happy with my choice and would recommend it to anyone who specifically needs or wants the handwriting capability.

Reviews.Title: Great for work and home
Reviews.Author: H. Asher
Reviews.Content: I've had this tablet for a few days now and enjoy it more and more.  The s note is PERFECT for taking notes at work.  Good bye paper!  I used to have various pads and sticky notes all over place.  To keep them organized, I would have to scan and e-mail them to myself.  Now I use the s-note and e-mail out meeting notes, etc, immediately at the close of meetings.  It's also a great media consumption tablet for when I am "off the clock".  The size is perfect to carry around.  I also bought a case with a removable BT keyboard.  That is outstanding as well.  Between finger input, s pen and the keyboard, I can always select my best input method. Well done Samsung.

Reviews.Title: Pros and Cons
Reviews.Author: dvaughn007
Reviews.Content: Pros:Great camerasDecent battery lifeS Pen!Cons:The size of the back and menu keys is too large.  When using the tablet in landscape mode my wife and I always hit one of those buttons.Split screen is limited to only a few apps.

Reviews.Title: I'm Content
Reviews.Author: R. L. Robinson "I like stuff."
Reviews.Content: I was looking for tablet upgrade (gave my Motorola Xoom to my father) and this seems to be the right choice. I read reviews about apps not being able to be saved externally but I'm confident that if you look hard enough, you can use an app that will allow your apps to be saved to the micro-sd.I tend to do a great deal of reading and watching movies/tv shows on tablets. I've found the "note taking" feature quite useful at work. Not just for meetings but collecting information from customers & PCs (employed in the IT field). The stylus is very responsive does have the feel of an actual pen or pencil.The size is more than adequate, slides right into my bag's inter-pocket with ease. The resolution isn't the best out there....but those tablets that do rock better screens can't do what this device does plain & simple. I have a Samsung S3 so navigating the OS & interface wasn't an issue at all. It's what I expected from this tablet with due to my experience with my S3.I've already set a calendar reminder on both devices instructing me to download the magnacartaholygrail application. I would recommend this product to individuals who put in a lot of hours with their tablets.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet
Reviews.Author: ladyd
Reviews.Content: I've only had this tablet for a few days but I love it so far. It's very responsive and comes with some of the apps I need...the others can be found in the Google play store. For those who complain about the manual/instructions not being included...there are lots of You tube videos explaining everything...hence a manual is NOT necessary. If you have used an android device before and loved it you would love this device, the stylus is the best part.. I am hesitant about updating from 4.1.2 to 4.2.2 after reading about others experiences. I will update if I do.

Reviews.Title: If it only had more Note 2/3 features
Reviews.Author: Charles Green
Reviews.Content: Since I love my Galaxy Note 2 (and I am an S Pen user), I wanted my next tablet to be a Note 8.0. A factory refurb for under $200 sealed the deal. I was disappointed that the 8.0 did not have some of the simple features of my Note 2:  No LED notification light when you have a message/email/etc.; no S pen keeper which sounds an alert and shows a pop up when you walk away with your device without attaching the S Pen; none of the cool writing features where, for example you make a written mistake and you can cross a line through it to delete the text or draw a line between letters to make a space. On the 8, you have to erase the entire word using the back button.  Also, the S Pen on the 2 pops out easily when you push it; the 8 requires you to really dig it out of its hole! Perhaps most of this can be fixed with a simple Android version upgrade (mine is 4.2.2)The good stuff:  Unlike the Note 2, the S Pen does work with the settings and return buttons at the bottom of the tablet (on the Note 2, you have to press it with your finger which is a pain with pen in hand).  The S Pen is slightly longer on the 8.0 which makes it easier to write.  The larger space to write has really helped my accuracy. and has me more interested in S Notes. It boots up quickly and is very responsive.  The size is perfect for portability (though a tad heavier than I anticipated) particularly for using the pen while holding it. The picture is sharp though I am still prefer my Kindle book when reading books.Overall I am very happy with the tablet and I hope the next Android  software upgrade will bring some of the features I love in my Note 2.

Reviews.Title: Thanks
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed using this a lot.  works really well and so far I've had no problem what so ever. Great.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT
Reviews.Author: Rebecca R.
Reviews.Content: I have three Special Needs Kiddos i'm on the go ALOT  I love having this I can get all the same apps on here that I have on my android phone....  it goes everywhere with me

Reviews.Title: Great tablet
Reviews.Author: J.
Reviews.Content: I purchased this for my son and he really likes it.  It was a replacement for a Sony tablet.  The clarity of the screen and speed of the tablet is keeping him very busy.  I would buy recommend this tablet.  I have iPad's and have had other Android tablets and this one is the best one I have had to date.

Reviews.Title: Like it
Reviews.Author: Doru Adrian Thom Popovici
Reviews.Content: The hardware inside the tablet is good, however the updates offered by Samsung are not. I had to reset everything to factory settings once the update finished.All in all is a good tablet, it would be a perfect tablet if Samsung offered better software support.

Reviews.Title: Nice but!
Reviews.Author: William David McNamara
Reviews.Content: Bought this to my replace my tab 2 10.1, It's the perfect size easier to handle and carry the only problem is the battery sucks. It lasts for maybe 3 hours and thats just with general use. Don't even try to watch a movie or TV show without it plugged in.

Reviews.Title: Best tablet!
Reviews.Author: kmaster54321
Reviews.Content: This tablet is just the best! Its fast, never lags. Great for games/surfing the web. I use it for college have all my books downloaded to it via the kindle app, i watch movies on it with the xfinity app.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet - good size, weight
Reviews.Author: D. Kronstadt "kronhead"
Reviews.Content: I had an old 10" tablet that i dropped, cracking the screen. It was not worth fixing that, so I researched various replacements - a new 10", or a 7" ... I already have a Samsung Galaxy S3, so the 7" seemed hardly worth the $ for the extra real estate. But I wanted something smaller and lighter than a 10" - this one fits the bill. It is my go-to reading device now - Kindle books, library books, magazines from Google Newsstand, newspaper apps, etc. For short trips away from home, I leave my laptop behind now...Buy one - you'll love it.

Reviews.Title: Samsung quality
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I have been impressed more and more by Samsung's efforts with the various Android devices and platforms.  After getting a couple of Tab2 7.0 tablets for my wife and son last year, I began to consider a tablet upgrade for myself.  I purchased a Toshiba Thrive a couple of years ago and I enjoy it very much, but it was starting to look a lot slower next to these newer devices.  After some deliberation, I elected to go with the Note 8.0.  After several months of use, I am very pleased with my decision.  The slightly non-standard size of the Note 8.0 has made getting some accessories more challenging, but the device features make the trade off worth it for me.  The biggest draw and feature is of course, the S-Pen.  I have found it to be very versatile and helpful.

Reviews.Title: Loveeeeeee my tablet!!!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I use it mainly for school. I either handwrite my papers or use a keyboard.  I carry this with me everywhere! i use it for school, emails, shopping... u name it! My phone and laptop are jealous! The best part is that its the perfect size to carry around! Got 1 for my boyfriend too!

Reviews.Title: Great purchase
Reviews.Author: Jeanette M. Teder
Reviews.Content: Love my Samsung!  I'm still trying to figure out all the bells and whistles but I feel like I've joined the 21st century!!!!!

Reviews.Title: better than best
Reviews.Author: Min Park
Reviews.Content: As a structural engineer, i write lots of calculation notes.My office is full of this calculation binders. Since i bought this note 8.0, i write everything in S note, and this is even better than writing on a piece of paper. I can even draw sketches and it is easier than drawing on paper. All the correspondences with other consultant became more efficient and it actually saves time. My coworker got note 10 and he loves his, but i like note 8 better than 10.only complaint i have is that the screen resolution is not that high, so you cannot write tiny letters.

Reviews.Title: Nice....refurbished ....great Price....lovely tablet
Reviews.Author: henry f garcia
Reviews.Content: I bought this tablet refurbished – After reading the mostly good reviews, I figured it was a less expensive way to give it a try. I have two ipad minis at home and a Samsung Tab2 which is STILL relevant and keeping up with our requirements that include streaming video from our NAS, games, book reading, email/ browsing and media room remote.Anyway, bought for $200 bucks – refurbished. It came in, looks brand new, at power on it took me through the initial set up which is idiot proof – not sure I understand some of the reviews that claim they don’t know how to get going on it (I should mention it did not come with a manual, it did come with a link to it which I have yet to feel the need to download), and then it was off to the races.Super quick. Quicker than the minis and my Tab2 (which I guess is no surprise). Was not however, expecting it to be noticeably quicker than the minis though…and it is.Great size at 8” 16:9 ratio. Movies fit real nice. Super wifi connectivity and speed (it actually tells you what your link speed is which I found cool). Image quality absolutely leaves the ipad minis behind, sharp, sharp and bright colors . The s pen is a really cool feature did not think I would care about it, but it feels like you are really writing /drawing with the sensitivity of the integrated Wacom digitizer….Button placement is fine…I do tend to activate the menu button here and there on accident, but then again I seem to activate apps on the minis by accident as well so I guess it just doesn’t bother me as much as some other reviewers.LOVE the fact that you can turn these puppies into a single remote for every room in the house. LOVE the sd card that you can load with 64 gb of whatever junk you like to carry in it ( loaded a couple movies an 40 gb of family pics (tablet has been in someone’s hands since I got it). Surprising from my girls whom I swore had the minis glued permanently to their hands.Quite happy so far but just got it this week-end. Will update in a few weeks and see if I am still enamored. So far yes. Oh and for $200 bucks? I am beginning to like this whole “refurbished” way to get some of these otherwise pricey gadgets.

Reviews.Title: Great Android tablet to have
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: With the S pen and 2GB Ram, it's way better than an iPad mini. I love it and use it every day for notes taking, browsing and media watching.

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth Ferguson
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my sister and she absolutely loves it and cant put it down. Very good buy !

Reviews.Title: sooo worth it.
Reviews.Author: Noelle
Reviews.Content: As a college student, I was really looking for something that did EVERYTHING without having the price to show for it. I bought my boyfriend the galaxy tab and thought it was great, so I really went back and forth trying to decide if the note was worth the extra cost.. let me just say it IS. The seemingly minor adjustments to the features actually make a huge difference, and the note taking capabilities literally are a life saver. I sync up my phone and touchpad calendars to keep me in order, eliminated the cost of buying notebooks for school, saved myself the hassle of lugging around my laptop for movies, and use the dual-screen capabilities on a daily basis. It's such a simple layout and the battery lasts forever. The resolution is really nice as well and I often times will use my touchpad for playing music in the morning while getting ready as well. I love being able to put it in my purse, and at the same time have it be big enough to watch movies and tv on.Con: restricted to only certain apps for dual screen.. but still many more than on the galaxy s4!Not sure if it does screen mirroring or s beam... that would be nice.Just all around a wonderful decision. So happy I spent the extra money on the note.

Reviews.Title: love it.
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: Samsung makes excellent devices.  I moved from my old android tablet (lenovo) to this one because my old one just stopped charging by usb.  I love the pen interface. THis has completely replaced all of notepads.  All of my lists and notes go here. No more paper!

Reviews.Title: Happy with my purchase
Reviews.Author: Susan Rouis
Reviews.Content: It is very easy to use. I like the fact that I can download books from the library to read. The print is easy to read and it weighs much less then a paperback book. I am still experimenting with the other things it can do. I like the fact that the camera is both front and back. The wifi signal reaches through my entire house and it is nice that I can take the Galaxy Note anywere in the house. I am not stuck in one room with it. I feel it was a good investment on my part.

Reviews.Title: Geeky One
Reviews.Author: Andrea M. Fernandez "closet techie"
Reviews.Content: This does about anything I could muster up.  So I would recommend this Table to anyone who is looking for an Android device.

Reviews.Title: I CAN'T STOP PUTTING THIS DOWN
Reviews.Author: S.Hody
Reviews.Content: I absolutely LOVE my tablet - I just wish there were more things for it like cases and such. I don't stop using this thing. The battery lasts for about all day if I'm using it to just write. If I'm playing a game it's like any other device, the battery gets cut. If you're looking for a tablet to use as a notebook and then to browse online or draw. This is the tablet for you. The stylus glides so much smoother on the 8" than the 10". Reviews.Title: A tablet for productivity
Reviews.Author: H. Takai "chemariachi"
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a tablet to take note, make sketches, etc... this is a good option. I like this tablet because of its size, and functionality. It may not have the highest resolution, best sound, and people may not think you're cool, but on the other hand it is very friendly when it comes to taking notes, making annotations, sketches, etc... Reviews.Title: Best tablet for note-taking
Reviews.Author: Yune Young Ji
Reviews.Content: I'm a full time college student and needed a good tablet for note taking as it is such a burden for carrying a big college note for average 4 different subjects per semester. At bought Ipad mini retina and samsung galaxy note 8.0 to compare. The winner goes to Samsung Galaxy Note 8.0 hands down! It has built-in note taking app with S-pen which is as accurate as real pen! And a lot of programs didn't work on Ipad mini works well on Galaxy note! I don't even use my macbook any more. I'm so satisfied with galaxy note! :D

Reviews.Title: great all purpose  tablet
Reviews.Author: recruit307
Reviews.Content: I keep this one in my family room and use to when I want instant access to email, internet, photos, etc.  Great camera.  Much better viewing than a smartphone.

Reviews.Author: Toya Washington

Reviews.Title: great tablet
Reviews.Author: elexus
Reviews.Content: I bought this tablet for my boyfriend and he loves it. It's great for when he does paperwork for work. I would definitely recommend this product. It even came earlier then expected,  it was perfect.

Reviews.Title: Mom loves it
Reviews.Author: Rob
Reviews.Content: smooth, fast, and replaces the ipad. does everything and anything. no lagg, awesome cam quality. Plays HD beyond fine. idk what more to say.

Reviews.Title: I couldn't think of a better tablet
Reviews.Author: Denise R.
Reviews.Content: I bought it as a replacement for my nexus 7(1st gen) because it couldn't connect to my tv. I use this for all sorts of things like streaming videos and taking down notes during meetings. I can't imagine my life without it. It has become an essential for me. I have an ipad which i barely use because of this, and I couldn't go back to using the nexus7 because this one is the complete package.

Reviews.Author: Marie
Reviews.Content: Quick Background: our household owns/uses the following: older generation Nexus 7, newer generation Nexus 7, this note, and the Sony Xperia (10 inch). Of all the tablets that I've owned, used or looked into, this is my favorite...Also, in case it's useful: I primarily use the tablet for taking notes, sending emails, reading, playing games, and sometimes, watching movies...Pros:1. Love the stylus -- I find it so useful for emails, etc. I've gotten amazingly fast with swype etc and actually get frustrated when I have to actually type-type with my thumbs, on a smart phone!!!2. It's a great size for most of the activities I like -- I use a kindle app for reading (other apps as well sometimes), it's great for watching movies, etc and wonderful for all the little stupid games I'm addicted to.3. It's generally light-weight and travels well4. Takes pictures etc well, though I honestly use that feature very, very rarely as I find it to be an awkard size for that particular function.5. This is a sillier one, but as a mom, I love the photo wall feature that zips through the pictures of my kids I have... (though I'm sure it's part of my battery-life-problem, see below)Cons:1. Reviews.Title: Love IT

Reviews.Title: Samsung Galaxy Tab Note 8.0
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "gosumec"

Reviews.Title: Modern day pen and pad, and so much more
Reviews.Author: Sean U
Reviews.Content: I took the plunge on a refurbished Note 8 and couldn't be happier. I have owned many pen devices over the years, from the original Compaq iPaq, IBM Wacom based Thinkpads, and the original Galaxy Note phone. I'm going to start this review by saying don't buy this tablet if you don't want a pen based device... there are cheaper options that will fill the tablet role without the added cost of the Wacom pen. If you are still reading, I'll assume you want a device with a real pen.The Note 8 is the perfect size for a note taking device. The Galaxy Note I phone I own and love just wasn't big enough to make the pen really useful for me. The design of the tablet is simple, with gently curved corners and a fairly wide bezel. The lack of an easily removable back provides decent rigidity that makes it feel less creaky than my phone. The back can be removed for a fairly easy battery replacement... but it is not meant to be swapped in and out like a phone battery.  I wish Samsung didn't put the big chrome logo on top, but it is what it is.The pen is slightly longer and fatter than the pen that comes with the Note phones. It is mostly round, with a flat side where the button is. The tip of the pen has a nice texture which adds some drag when used on the glass. The nib is not replaceable with standard Wacom nibs. I personally use a Wacom pen that I purchased for my laptop. It has the eraser on one end and replaceable nibs. It is the size of a standard pen, and obviously won't fit in the tablets pen holder. I find it much nicer to write with than the provided pen.From an inking perspective, the pen is accurate for me. I'm left handed and I don't have any issues with the alignment of the nib and on-screen cursor position. There is some minor lag if you are drawing fast where you may notice the ink takes a fraction of a second to catch up. It's not horrible, but may be noticeable and annoying if you are expecting the device to be just like ink and paper. In truth, it's pretty fast compared to other Wacom devices I've used. I *always* put a screen protector on my pen devices... while the glass is durable, all it takes is a small grain to get caught on your tip or eraser to make a scratch. I am using the iSmooth Samsung Galaxy Note 8 Ultra Clear Premium HD Screen Protector 2 Pack which is working out well.If you are looking for a case, check out the MoKo Slim Cover Case for Samsung Galaxy Note 8.0 inch GT - N5100 Android Tablet, Black (with lip Stand, Integrated Elastic Hand Strap, and Stylus Loop)-Lifetime Warranty. It fits well and the brown leather looks nice in contrast to the white tablet. There is some talk about the magnets in many of the cases interfering with the s-pen, possibly even causing permanent problems, so I took an exacto knife and carefully removed them from the case.On the application side, S-Note is where the Note 8 makes the S-Pen shine. It does everything you would expect a note taking app to do, including the ability to export notes to a pdf for sharing with non S-Note users. The only thing missing for me feature in Microsoft One Note where it translates your ink in the background and makes your handwritten notes searchable.From a general perspective of tablet use, the Note 8 works fine. The lcd is sharp and has great viewing angles. Video playback is smooth and the device feels very snappy in general. I appreciate that Samsung still provides a micro sd slot... it is becoming too rare these days. As is normal for Samsung, they add in their usual bloatware apps that can't be removed. While you can root the Galaxy Note 8, if you install an Android rom like Cyanogenmod you will loose the ability to run S-Note and many of the other tightly integrated s-pen features. Samsung tends to be stingy with their OS updates, and I'll be surprised if they support the device after 4.4 Kitkat. The battery is good, but not stellar. Be careful with apps that provide background notifications/updates as they will chew away at your battery when the tablet is idle.In summary, the Note 8 is almost perfect for me. If Microsoft released a fully functional version of One Note for Android I would be in heaven, but it will never happen. The Surface Pro is just too big and expensive for what I need. At the current price, the refurbished Note 8 is about the same price as a good new 7" tablet without a pen, which seems like a great deal to me.

Reviews.Title: Good product, kids love the control they have using the pen
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "JS"
Reviews.Content: This is a good product for people/kids who wants little more control on touch. the s-pen makes is easy for kids to practise drawing, writing etc. my kid uses it as rough paper to do her math home work.dont like all the junk apps that come with the tablet and you cannot remove most of them (unless you root it) but one good thing, some of them you can disable.so far i think its better than ipad (at least for my needs). some nice featuers like controlling your tv (this acts a remote) but not useful for me as i dont have cable connection.

Reviews.Title: Love this notebook!
Reviews.Author: ronniemac
Reviews.Content: Great tablet. Love size and convenience and all of its features. Especially like the S-pen. Great way of inputting on the go!

Reviews.Title: Nice electronic tablet

Reviews.Content: Only have used it for 3 weeks.  It seems to perform well.  Has all the bells and whistles.  Once in a while there will be a slight delay in the response time.  The wife does not use computers or electronics.  On this she quickly learned to email and use the book reader and Netflix movies.

Reviews.Title: awesome

Reviews.Content: I like this better than the ipad mini and I use the stylus pen all the time even though I never thought I would.  My only complaint thus far is the battery life is a little low, but not awful.

Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "txspurgin"
Reviews.Content: There was little doubt that I was going with the Samsung Note, but which size? I am thrilled so far (been a few days) that I chose the 8.0 ( GT-N511). So much nicer than my ancient 10 inch Acer. The aNote and WatchOn apps are brillant. The clarity of the screen (using a clear HD screen protector) is amazing. I still have much more fun ahead. You will need some time adjusting to holding this tablet, like any hand held device. My thumbs are occassionally hitting the back button (bottom right of home button).Beware that you probably DO NOT want to upgrade the OS to 4.2.2. The original came with 4.1.2, but when I upgrade to 4.2.2, the awesome Smart Dock turned dunce. Samsung Customer Service said that the Smart Dock isn't compatible, but there are videos of people having success with the Note 8.0 and Smart Dock...they were using Android 4.1.2 though! And there is no way to downgrade unless you Root/Flash the device (which voids the warranty). So buyer beware.So if you don't care about the Smart Dock incompatibility, then this is your tablet!

Reviews.Title: Excellent!
Reviews.Author: Terri Stalons
Reviews.Content: We shopped at best buy and couldn't get anyone to wait on us. So I pulled out my phone and looked this product up on amazon and was surprised to see exactly what I wanted and $50 less than best buy. It was a Christmas gift for our daughter and she loves it! It will be a big help to her as she returns to college in a few days. I would recommend it to everyone who wants a note or tablet.

Reviews.Title: Love this tablet! +what would make it better
Reviews.Author: A. Lee
Reviews.Content: I've been using this tablet for over 6 months now and still absolutely love it.  In my mind this is the *only* mid-size tablet that gets pen input right, which is unique.  The digitizer based screen is a HUGE benefit and makes note taking or sketching very pleasant.  I use this every day for taking notes and it actually works -- fast and accurate.  AND one of the least-often touted advantages of the digitizer is the fact you can *hover* buttons in a browser, so pull-downs and other menus are actually usable.  No other tablet -- iPad or otherwise -- can do that.I have also looked at tablet PCs from Microsoft, Sony, etc but keep coming back to the Galaxy Notes as the best option for portability, features, app selection, and price.  Even now after the release of Nexus 7 and iPad mini retina I still think this is the best tablet for artists or note takers.  If you just need a tablet for touch, I agree with other reviewers that you can get a better bang for the buck with a Nexus 7 or non digitizer-based tablet.Of course, no product is perfect so here are some things I would want in the next version:- Higher res screen, 1080p or better- Bigger stylus with more weight (I bought a separate Samsung stylus, don't use the original)- Better battery life -- I get about 1 day with heavy use, 2 days with light use, 2.5 days at standby.  Would prefer 3-4 days of juice.- Better case/cover options -- the official Samsung case is flimsy and others are not as high quality as iPad equivalents

Reviews.Title: love this tablet....
Reviews.Author: D. Davis
Reviews.Content: I've been using an ipad for years, this is my first droid device and I am very happy!  I love the stylus and being able to take notes with it, that was the main reason I chose the note 8.0

Reviews.Title: Galaxy Note 8.0
Reviews.Author: Stephanie Puangchinda

Reviews.Content: Resolution could be slightly crisper but still really sharp.Camera hump on the back is annoying especially since the back camera isn't that good.Other than that it's a really nice responsive tablet and the pressure sensitive pen is great for drawing.

Reviews.Title: Love this tablet
Reviews.Author: Mister Dodo
Reviews.Content: Does freaking everything. S Pen helps with jotting down notes and integration with Google Drive allows me to access all my school assignments..

Reviews.Title: Galaxy Note 8.0 - Just Right!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: If I could I would give this tablet a rating  of 4.5 stars. It's not perfect  because I often accidentally press the power and return buttons. That's very annoying when it happens while I'm watching Netflix, HBO Go or when I'm reading a book. I'm using the Moko Ultra Slim Lightweight case  for protection but it has the power and volume buttons fully exposed. Other cases may solve my problem, but I haven't looked into it yet. The GN8.0 is also very expensive but it has the features that I want in a tablet. While I was willing to pay extra, I still wish that its price is lower.I wanted it for its size, good screen resolution, IR controller, and the S-pen. Like many of the reviewers here, I own multiple devices. I  have  the iPad, HP Touchpad, iPhone and the Samsung S3 but lately, I  tend to use the GN8.0 more frequently. The S-pen, with the Google keyboard, is very convenient for taking notes. I also like it when I can  easily switch to sketching with a precise pen.The remote control feature is also nice to have. I can control the home theater in the family room, the master bedroom TV and the TV in my sister's house.  It works with the Panasonic, Samsung and Sony TVs that I have tried to control. I don't know if there is a  limit to the number of devices I can configure. I will find out when  have visited my siblings and friends. Bottom line, I'm happy with this purchase. It meets my needs just right.

Reviews.Title: Simply amazing
Reviews.Author: Kicou
Reviews.Content: I love my note 8. For someone who is always carrying a note book and taking note this device is a must. The size is perfect and fits in my purse, its light weight and very easy to use.The best part to me is the stylus pen. If im on a website and I only need one paragraph I simply circle it and transfer it to the note pad.When ideas come, I voice note it or I write it on the memo pad which comes up as soon as you take out the pen.The multiple screen is a another great feature.  Works great when watching a video and taking notes. Or writing an email while on a website.My note is with me 24/7 :-)

Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer

Reviews.Title: It works for me!
Reviews.Author: c joy "book lover/ dual android/apple user"
Reviews.Content: I was on the fence about this device but the in depth reviews on amazon convinced me to give it a try. I have owned the galaxy note 8 for over a month and can find no major fault with it. I was consdering the ipad mini 2 but since I own a galaxy s2  and other samsung tablets I went with Samsung instead. I  prefer the more open android platform to apples closed, tightly controlled devices.The screen is very bright and its quad core processer provides a very snappy response. I am getting 8 to 9 hours battery life by adjusting the wifi radio to shut off when in standby mode.i did have problems with the $25 google play credit but contacted samsung support on facebook. I received my credit within 24 hours. I also went with the box.com free 50 GB cloud service because there  is no time limit. Too many hoops to jump through with dropbox.  This  is a tablet for productivity great for students, business people and anyone wishing to organize their ideas.I am currently using the poetic slim case which offers good protection without a lot of bulk. I have odered the s pen with eraser as a second pen for note taking.  It is unfortunate that amazon prime movies will not play on this tabet, even with the adobe flash apk, only movie trailers will play. It has to do with adobe drm protection. Reviews.Title: Battery voids all positives
Reviews.Author: aleks
Reviews.Content: I started with the Galaxy Note 10.1 but found it too heavy and too big for regular use.While the screen capabilities made the Galaxy Note 8 an attractive device (love the handwriting recognition and accessories) the fact that the battery wouldn't last more than 2-3 hours with mild use has caused me to switch to an ipad mini.The size and weight are great but the battery made this impossible to keep.

Reviews.Title: Crisp and bright display, lightweight.  Perfect size.
Reviews.Author: SonorousGiraffe
Reviews.Content: I once read that Apple said they would never produce an iPad smaller than 10" because that's what they determined through studies to be the best.Since getting the Note 8, I hardly use my iPad at all.  In fact, I now find it to be heavy and clunky when compared to the Note.I have found this to be the perfect size as I can hold it in one hand, or not feel like I'm cradiling a TV tray in both hands.  It's perfect for games and the resolution is amazing.Battery life is much better than my Galaxy S3, considering that the Note 8 is a quad-processor.Very solid device and does not feel cheap, despite the plastic back.The S-Pen is very nice and responsive.  I like how the device turns on and unlocks when the pen is removed.  Pen location is located in the bottom right corner.  One would expect it to be at the top of the device, but being able to pull down instead of pull up seems to be more ideal.  When pen is docked, it blends seemlessly with the rounded corner.  Easily detaches by running your fingernail down.For the price, you would definately want to check into the Note 8 if you are looking at a Nook or Fire, as those reader apps are available on the Note.

Reviews.Title: The Perfect Tablet, But Not for me
Reviews.Author: kryptonnms
Reviews.Content: I never thought I'd get any tablet.  I'm a desktop and laptop user and have a Galaxy S4.  I thought that Android wouldn't leave my phone.  I'm an artist, and thought I'd try this tablet out particularly for that.  I normally use Paint Tool SAI and Photoshop on Windows, but heard good things about Sketchbook.  This tablet is quick, and it's just the right size, but my way of doing things whether it's web browsing or art didn't match up.  Any art programs I tried missed one thing or another that were crucial to me.  This is the software, and not the tablet.  The only bad thing I could say about the tablet is the S Pen.  It's good and accurate, but the tip is plastic and slides around a bit too much on the glass screen.  It's also quite flimsy..I felt like I was goingto break it. (I push hard when I draw.)I'd keep this over an Ipad anyday, but for me, it wasn't worth the 300+ and sent it back.  Don't let my review deter you though.  The four stars is a serious one and my cons shouldn't affect most.

Reviews.Title: Best small Android tablet out there!
Reviews.Author: Mark Foshee
Reviews.Content: Only tablet that offered every feature I wanted (and then some):Fast quad core processor2GB memory16GB onboard storage (almost 10GB usable for your programs, which is excellent)micro SD slot (up to 64GB)stereo speakers, and NOT on the back (louder than my old Galaxy Tab 7, first version), great for Stitcher!Gorilla Glass for durabilitygood screen res. (720P+ resolution and looks GREAT)decent battery life (I've gotten over 8+ hours of use, split between note taking and watching videos)light weight (300 grams, 10% less than my old Galaxy Tab 7, vastly lighter than current i(brick)Pad)Just wish it came it black, but got used to it quickly

Reviews.Title: I left my iPad for this, never looked back.
Reviews.Author: James Digini
Reviews.Content: I limit my reviews to items I really love or really hate and I really love this product! I have the GS3 so picking up a Note 8 was a very easy move. I had a 3rd gen iPad retina display which worked fine but I never really loved it or any of the Apple products. I willingly handed off my iPad to my wife as soon as I got this. I study a lot, usually in epub or pdf format, and the Note 8 is great for studying. If you are a student, this is a must have. The S-pen functionality adds a dimension to the tablet market that, once used, is hard to do without. I find myself using this far more that I ever used my iPad. It's lighter weight and smaller dimensions make it easier to take with. My hands would get tired after long reading sessions with my iPad but the Note is so light that's never been a problem. The display is STUNNING and the quad core processor is very snappy! Sure the iPad mini is cheaper but the iPad mini is a cheaper product in more ways than just price. Take into account the 50gb Dropbox upgrade for two years and this is a no-brainer. The Note 8 in my opinion is the best tablet on the market. I'd recommend this to ANYONE no matter what their tech level.

Reviews.Title: A fun, productive tablet
Reviews.Author: mbroczko
Reviews.Content: I am a college student and wanted a supplement for my laptop. I wanted the everyday functionality my laptop offered me, but without the weight and process of setting it up. This tablet offers all the features that a productive student needs.The integrated spen and snote are simple yet elegant, making it easy to write notes on the fly with accuracy. Being a math major, I especially love the handwriting to text application for it can pick up mathematical characters and put it all into text. I am not just talking about multiplication and division. The spen was able to differentiate a partial differentiation symbol from the number 2 which look very similar. The spen is well polished and a joy to use.The screen resolution is not the highest on the market, but it still produces a very crisp and sharp image that is very pleasant to the eye.Being a former apple user, I learned that the Android operating system can be overwhelming, but after a couple days you get used to it. Overall the operating system is a lot more efficient than ios and a lot more fun. Also if you feel like the display is just too much, Samsung added the easy mode for the home screen which is a great starting point for those not as familiar with Android.Samsung has loaded this tablet with apps. Some will be used everyday while others may be left to the side and forgotten. The app store is well stocked with apps as well but definitely not to the degree as the apple store.Underneath the hood is a 1.6 GHz quad core processor with 2 gb RAM. What this means is that this table is great for multitasking. Internet runs seamlessly and loading videos is not an issue with this tablet. Unfortunately it only has 16 gb of storage with a decent portion of it already filled by the OS and pre-installed apps. It makes up for this by having a micro SD slot which can hold all your pictures, music, and videos. Also, Samsung has a partnership with Drop box which gives 50 gb of storage for 2 years.Cameras are decent but nothing special. I was disappointed that there was no flash on the back camera.The price is on the high side. It being $70 more than the Ipad mini can be a massive deterrent to many people. But when you take into account the amount of money you would need to spend to get an adequate note taking app and stylus for the ipad mini, the price difference definitely gets smaller.Overall a great tablet for those who want to be more productive. If you are looking for a tablet for just looking on facebook and playing games, then I would recommend looking at the IPad instead, but if you want a tablet that can supplement your work but still be a lot of fun, spend a few more dollars and buy the Note 8

Reviews.Title: Note 8.0 an upgrade? Not so sure
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I had a samsung tab 3  8.0 and thought I would upgrade to the note 8.0. After using the note for a few days I'm really questioning why the price difference on these two devices. The note has a faster process but honestly it hasnt made much of difference to my user experience - it seems about the same to me. Even though i was well aware that the note has a broader bezel than the tab 3 it was still a big let down when i actually received the note in hand. In comparison to the tab 3 it truly looks and feels like an older model tablet. So for those who are all into appearance the tab 3 takes this one hand's down. The s-pen or my new obsession as I call it is a really cool device if you can get it to work properly. My experience has been difficult with the s-pen because when trying to write with the pen my hand is constantly pressing the return button as well as the other options at the bottom of the screen. So although I love the idea of the s pen I find it a little tedious to use, not to mention that the handwriting recogniton is little questionable. Again although I love theidea of the s-pen, for a user like myself who uses tablets mainly for watching movies, games and surfing the web I dont find it that useful for much other than being a stylus. Despite my comments I do like this device I dont think the price difference between the tab and the note is justifiable. The tab 3 gave me evrything that I wanted in a nice package and at a great price - I note provides features that clearly i can do without and which is not missed on the tab 3.  To each his own but after using both devices i would recommend the tab 3 over the note.

Reviews.Title: Could have been the best but 2 fatal flaws
Reviews.Author: B100
Reviews.Content: Galaxy Note 8.0 review.Very good tablet but falls short in some critical ways.I like the size and I find it the most functional tablet next to my Galaxy Note 10.1 except for some critical flaws that made me decide to return it.1. Bad baattery. Don't know if I got a defective unit, but the battery life is unacceptable for my use (there was likely something wrong with the unit, but if there's something I can't stand in a mobile device, it's poor battery life)2. 16GB of internal storage just doesn't cut it for me. Without installing a single game or storing a single picture or music or movie, I was beginning to run out of space just after installing "most" of my apps, that I actually use, and yes I have an SD card (but everyone not living under a rock knows that since ICS Android no longer supports A2SD), and heck no, I have no intention of hacking and switching my external SD for internal SD (been there, done that and all the resulting problems are not what I have the time to deal with)The above issues were the biggest problems with it.Other things I would change are:1 Higher resolution screen with excellent sunlight legibility2 Make it even lighter3 Better robust speakers4 Add flash to the camera and equip it with better camerasI think if you get a unit without a bad battery, this would be really functional, assuming you'll not be installing a lot of apps on it. I don't think you'll find any tablet right now that offers the utility in terms of taking notes and just being productive (besides the Note 10.1 if you don't mind the size).It's sad I'll be returning it. Maybe if the battery was good I'd have kept it and lived with the restrictive memory.For now I'll stay away from every tablet or phone with anything less than 32GB of internal storage. BTW, when your internal storage drops to about 2.5gb your phone or tablet will begin to lag. This is the cause of lag in a lot of devices. Keep you internal storage at about 3.5gb and you'll likely see no lag.

Reviews.Title: GREAT Tablet OFFERING unique and AWESOME functions
Reviews.Author: Zoe
Reviews.Content: I bought it from another site (thing I regret). The thing I regret is that the other site was advertising $25 google play gift card, which I just discover to be an offer from Samsung and not the site itself, and I had to pay taxes that showed up at the email confirmation.This tablet might seem overpriced, but it isn't. What you buy for $399 is a complete package which includes 2 year of dropbox (50 GB) for free... lets say $399 - $100 = $299. Now the tablet is like just costed about $299, -$25 google play gift card from samsung = $274. And now lets say minus Awesome note app which cost 5 dollars in iTunes, and the universal remote function... The price you pay is about $250 for this tablet + EXPANDABLE STORAGE!!!Now lets talk about its performance:There is no worry about this tablet having lag or anything on the matter, you can compare it to the iPad and Nexus devices and it would run at the same level, although it (Note 8) has more software capabilities. The camera is really kind of bad when you compare it to the iPad mini, or the iPod Touch 5G, but would do the trick in good lighting conditions.The software really adds to the experience and utility of the tablet. The multi window function works without any fault. It is fluid and doe not cause problems. The S pen really can create awesome works and tasks much easier. Am going to download the PS Touch with the $25 gift card, and I guess the S Pen is really going to come handy.Am sorry to not have a really good structured review, but I promise to update it after a month of the note 8 usage. I also want to add that I have had an iPad, iPod Touch 5G, Nexus 7, and a Sony Tablet and currently an iPad mini.I definitely would recommend this tablet to any one, but especially to the people that are looking forward new innovative software. The s pen as a college student add a lot of functionality on my algebra homework (less paper to waist). If you just want a tablet for emails, apps and web browsing-- look at the nexus devices and iPad, but IF YOU WANT MORE THAN THAT!!!!t.. THIS IS THE TABLET FOR YOU. My review would be 4 times bigger if I explained every function of the s pen and the tablet it self. Feel free to ask any questions.

Reviews.Title: Samsung Galaxy Note tablet 8.0
Reviews.Author: Lauren Giglio
Reviews.Content: I bought the Samsung Galaxy Note 8.0 for upcoming travel abroad so I could check my email, news and read books while traveling.  Laptop too big and bulky for personal travel.  Using an Android or I phone overseas is expensive due to roaming fees, but with a tablet you just need a WiFi connection, which are generally free.  So a tablet is perfect for travel. The 8.0" Note is the perfect size for travel also ... the 10 and 12" sizes would be too big and bulky.It didn't take long to get the tab setup for my email account, homepage, and other apps I use on my laptop ... just a bit of learning curve.  Once I was setup,  I found that the tablet was a great substitute for my laptop with mobility in my house and outside wherever WIFI is available. When I was doing research for the tablet, I ran into a IT guy at a computer store who said he uses his tablet much more than his laptop when he's on off site location, which is what I am finding.  So even though I made the purchase for travel, I find the tablet is so much better than I 1st thought ... A GREAT BUY!!

Reviews.Title: Good tablet, great price, effective handwriting recognition
Reviews.Author: R. Mason
Reviews.Content: Pros:  - The pen  - The Screen  - Solid tablet in all other respectsCons:  - Slippery glossy back  - A bit big  - Price (but as a refurb, the price issue went away)Being older (though quite technical), I really never fully made the jump from handwriting to thumb typing. Having the ability to write my notes is much more intuitive to me that to hunt and peck at an on screen keyboard.  But, all the capacitive stylus hardware and software I have tried is crude and inaccurate. Basically a waste of time.  So I thought I'd give the Galaxy Note a try.  I have always wondered why, if Palm could make it work (albeit with a shorthand language) 15 years ago, why couldn't someone make it work really well today, given the advances in software and processing power.  Well, Samsung seems to have done just that.  So while in other respects this tablet is really not noticeably different than other 7/8 inch tablets, for me, the pen really makes a difference.So why only 4 starts?  First, I reserve 5 for near perfect only, and this is great, but has a couple issues:  1) the smooth glossy back. It may look pretty, but it doesn't give much grip. I prefer my (now given away) Nexus 7 in that regard.  2) the size - while 8 inch does give noticeably more screen size, it goes from being easily hand held, to marginal - really a bit big for long term holding.  I don't have huge hands, but their not tiny either - probably average to slightly large for men. I could see this bordering on being a two hand device for women.  Again, I prefer the 7" nexus in this regard.But in the end, the pen makes the difference. And as I bought this as a refurbished unit, at a deep discount - total price close to new "normal" tablets, I am quite happy.

Reviews.Content: I ended up buying this from a different vendor because Amazon was taking too long to ship it to me. So, I returned theirs when it finally came. Reviews.Title: NO more Apple Welcome DROID!

Reviews.Content: l have been an apple user for many years.  I wanted a new tablet but I was not looking for an Apple product.  I researched the new Samsung Note 2014 10 inch and thought...that was the tablet for me.  I resigned myself to saving the money (cost is high).  But, on a drive home with my husband we started a pros and cons list...and I discovered that what I wanted was in this product.Pros:I wanted the S pen - I travel alot and need to take quick notes. A very quick settings change allowed me to have a note "pop up" when I take the S pen out.  For me, this is a big plus. I can write (amazing) a quick note and save.I am not a gamer,  so I needed my work apps to function on this tablet. They do!! My point is I was not looking for something that could process a game quicker, but allow me to work off the tablet with the S pen seamlessly.  This tablet does that.Lastly,  I was concerned about being able to function day to day on the new tablet...meaning can I access and complete all the functions that I did before (with my ipad). I am very happy with that.Cons:Connection to my WIFI can be spotty.  I carry a hot spot so I travel with the WIFI version of this tablet and need quick access.  I have only had to restart the tablet once when it could not connect, and have had some issues with the overall connection to a home WIFI. As much as I use it, I thought it was worth mentioning.Loading web pages can be slow (slower) - I only mention thia as I expected faster processing but WAS able to complete every task I neededOverall, I am in love, so much so I bought another Samsung for my son.Honestly, I cannot wait to research and find out more cool tricks that I can exploit to make my day easier.I recommend.

Reviews.Title: Amazing tablet - Fantastic for artists and note takers
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I almost bought the 2013 Nexus 7 but decided on this one instead and I am so glad I did.  The s-pen makes this tablet what it is. For short notes or writing in other apps the handwriting recognition is good enough.Other aspects of the tablet are fine. The IR port works but is kind of irrelevant to me as I seldom watch TV with it.  Screen resolution is plenty sharp for my near-sighted eyes.  The processor is quick and snappy and I've barely used up much of the 16gb (more like 8 or 9 after all the preloaded Samsung stuff).  I have an SD card to expand the memory but haven't needed much of that space either except for my growing collection of sketches.  The expandability is nice if I ever do run out of space.Overall I love the tablet as it allows me to create content easily and not merely consume it. Reviews.Title: Text recognition and S Note challenged; where's decent documentation?
Reviews.Author: Michigan Techie
Reviews.Content: I've been looking for a tablet which matches a definition of a device where I can write notes freehand on the fly and have the notes reliably transcribed in a usable format. Unfortunately, I'm still looking, after having bought and experimented with the Samsung Note 8. I will update my review in the future as appropriate, but at this point, I'm not happy.Using the S Note application with the S Pen for text recognition is an exercise in frustration. I tried writing a list in freehand, which would be transcribed into text. What I found was that it was difficult to fix transcription errors while writing, the transcription couldn't keep up, the margins changed randomly and the text lines would shift.I looked for meaningful documentation that would clearly explain the functionality of the S Note application and I couldn't find any. There are a lot of buttons and options, but no clear documentation. The videos that Samsung provides are interesting, but very peripheral and don't really help someone who has bought the tablet and needs to do something with it. The videos appear to be mostly pre-sales marketing tools.A random annoyance is that the Google Now widget displays "cards", but upon clicking the widget, the device apologies that Google Search has "stopped".I already own an iPad 3 and was hoping this device would meet my requirements for a small device I could pull out for writing notes as needed. However I'm a disappointed with the Note 8 at this point.Update #1 (March 16, 2014, updating rating  to 2 stars): It appears the Google Now problem is related to a recent update.  A commenter on Google Search in the "Play Store" claimed having the same problem with Google Now on a Note 8. I had cleared the Google Search cache and data to no avail.  When I backed out of the Google Search update, Google Now appeared to behave correctly.Having dug around a bit more with the "S Note" application, I understand it better. Yet, challenges persist:1) There is a noticeable period (perhaps an average of 2 seconds) where the tablet is working on the text recognition and the tablet is not accepting input from the S Pen.  This results in a period where one is writing freehand text, but the tablet is not recording the writing.  This makes writing more than a few words at a time frustrating.  Understanding how the text recognition algorithm works and allowing for adjustment would be helpful here.  For example, it would be useful if I could set a timer which waited for perhaps 5 seconds after the last S Pen "stroke" before attempting text recognition.2) Looking at example "templates", the maximum number of words in the template appear to be a sentence or less. This would suggest that the software developers either didn't design the application to handle more than a sentence at a time, or there are hardware limitations which makes attempting to write more than a sentence at a time difficult.3) A hope is that there exist other applications which work with the Note 8 that have a better text recognition workflow. As I learned when I wrote freehand text on my iPad, it's nifty that I can write this text, but it's not so nifty that my options for doing something with the writing (such as text recognition) afterwards are limiting.A different random annoyance is that when opening up Google News with the "Internet" or "Chrome" browsers, the screen appears to initially render completely, but all of the news and headline text disappears.In my experience, the automatic brightness adjustment causes the screen to be too dark or dim in many cases.

Reviews.Author: MUSIC LOVER
Reviews.Content: I've had my Galaxy note 8 for over a week and I have to say I'm pretty happy with the device. I take a lot of notes and this device seems to be great for taking notes. I did extensive research for tablets with stylus support, even looked at the iPad mini and the Evernote stylus, but was not convince with the amount of apps designed for stylus support. I also did not want to get locked into using just Evernote on the iPad. With the Note 8.0 I have the capability to take written notes using various note taking apps.I would definitely recommend this tablet for anyone who takes notes and needs that ability to share them. This is not your average tablet, it's mostly aimed folks who take notes, draw, sketch, color and so on and so on.If you are looking for an average tablet for casual internet browsing or checking e-mail, I would recommend getting a tablet like a Nexus 7 or a Samsung Tab.

Reviews.Title: GREAT Tablet
Reviews.Author: Eric B
Reviews.Content: I was the owner of the Galaxy Tab 2, which is a 7 inch tablet. My main issue with that tablet was the limited onboard storage of 8GB.Granted it did offer expandable space with the min SD, but 8 GB fills up quickly.The Note 8.0 has 16 GB, though really ~6GB are used by Android. Perhaps there is a way to trim this, we'll see. More onboard storage gives me more confidence to locally store the 2GB of important documents that I need access to. The device also features the expandable mini SD, so I have plenty of space for media.The 8 inch screen makes a nice difference on viewing movies, playing the Tower Defense games that I enjoy, and even in the viewing of .doc or .pdf files. The S-Pen has become my primary mode for data entry and I use the tablet for all of my meetings and note-taking, it is that effective. I also author blog posts using the S-Pen.Overall, two BIG thumbs up on this device.
